item.title: Come, Make In India: PM Modi's Invite To the world
item.description: From Delhi's imposing Red Fort early on Friday morning, Prime Minister Narendra Modi made an extempore first Independence Day speech, telling the world, "Come, make in India. Sell anywhere, but manufa...

item.title: Discrimination Fears Rife in Telangana as State Prepares for Survey
item.description: A state government survey to be held on August 19 has struck fear into the residents of Telangana. While the government insists it is meant to stop leakages, residents fear it is a precursor to denyin...

item.title: PM's Choice of Turban: The Jodhpuri Safa
item.description: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered his maiden Independence Day speech today, his bright red-and-green turban wasn't just a sartorial statement, but it seemed to showcase his journey to the coun...

item.title: At Rashtrapati Bhavan, PM Modi Signs Autographs for Public
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was at the centre of attention today at the 'At Home' function hosted by President Pranab Mukherjee on the occasion of the 68th Independence Day in New Delhi.

item.title: Jet Airways, Etihad Partner to Offer Fliers Discounted Fares
item.description: Jet Airways and its strategic investment partner Etihad have offered discounts ranging from 20 per cent to 68 per cent to fliers on regular fares over the combined network of the two airlines.

item.title: Imran Khan Travelling in Bullet-Proof Car After Vehicle Shot At
item.description: Cricketer-turned-politician Imran Khan, leading protesters to the Pakistani capital of Islamabad for a sit-in demanding the ouster of Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, today boarded a bullet-proof car afte...

item.title: 53 Children Hospitalised in Madhya Pradesh After Eating Mid-Day Meal at School
item.description: 53 children were admitted to hospital today after consuming mid-day meals served at their school in Icchawar in Madhya Pradesh's Sehore district.

item.title: Zest, Bolt Success Holds Key to Tata Motors Car Business Profits: Moody's
item.description: The profitability of the struggling domestic unit of Tata Motors, especially that of its passenger car division, depends on the success of the newly-launched sedan Zest and the forthcoming Bolt, Moody...

item.title: Delhi School Students 'Discover' Two Asteroids
item.description: Two new asteroids have been discovered by a team of students from two schools in Delhi as part of a nationwide campaign.

item.title: For British Spy in Iraq, Affection Is Strong but Legacy Is Unfulfilled
item.description: A picture of Gertrude Bell, the British diplomat and spy, still hangs on a wall in the Alwiya Club, the Baghdad clubhouse for the social elite that she established, and black-and-white photographs of ...

item.title: Narendra Modi's Slogan Spree in Maiden Independence Day Speech
item.description: "Zero defect, zero effect" was one of the many slogans Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave today in his 65-minute long maiden speech from the ramparts of Red Fort to drive home his point.

item.title: Congress Slams PM's Maiden Independence Day Speech as 'Zero-Effect'
item.description: Congress today attacked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for delivering a "zero effect" speech and getting bogged down in "pedestrian issues" on Independence Day, saying it had "no new ideas, new schemes,...

item.title: 2014 Renault Duster AWD Review
item.description: There are not many changes to the exterior of the car but Renault has managed to give the Duster AWD a unique set of alterations which sets it apart from the regular car. To begin with it gets, what R...

item.title: Imran Khan Safe, Gun Shots Fired at His Car in Anti-Government March
item.description: Clashes broke out in the Pakistani city of Gujranwala on Friday after gun shots were fired at the vehicle of opposition leader Imran Khan as he led an anti-government march to the capital.

item.title: Opinion: PM Modi Ends Years of Dull Red Fort Speeches
item.description: Reassuring and invigorating comments hit the sweet spot, writes Ashok Malik.

item.title: PSU Banks Barred from Campus Recruitment
item.description: In a recent directive to PSU banks, the Finance Ministry has asked not to make any appointment against the permanent vacancies by resorting to campus recruitment/interview mechanism.

item.title: Difference Between PMs Modi and Vajpayee, as Explained by Amit Shah
item.description: The unfurling of the national flag at Red Fort by a "BJP worker" marked a "big day" for the party workers, new BJP president Amit Shah said today.

item.title: Credit Card Payments: Should You Pay in EMIs?
item.description: You must think of the EMI option only if you're on the verge of defaulting a payment. This saves your CIBIL score from going down.

item.title: More Than PM Modi, Congress Helped Us Win, Says LK Advani
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi "also contributed" to the BJP's stellar performance in the national election, but the victory was powered by the Congress, said senior BJP leader LK Advani today.

item.title: No More Passes For PM Modi's Independence Day Speech, Some Diplomats Were Told
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Independence Day debut at the Red Fort had diplomats scrambling for seats and some could not get a spot, top sources today said.

item.title: Mumbaikars Heading Out For Long Weekend Trapped in Nightmare Traffic
item.description: Thousands of commuters are stuck on the main expressway between Mumbai and Pune, as people head out of the financial capital to holiday over the four-day weekend.

item.title: This Dalit Sarpanch in Morena Finally Gets to Celebrate Independence Day
item.description: If it is a "tribute to Indian democracy that a person from a poor family" could address the nation today from the ramparts of the Red Fort, in Puravas Kalan village of Madhya Pradesh, 34-year-old Bada...

item.title: The Soldiers We Forgot From a Gigantic War 100 Years Ago
item.description: A 100 years ago, about 16 million people died in the deadly conflict called the First World War. 74,187 were Indians.

item.title: I Am an Outsider to Delhi, Stresses PM Modi in His Speech
item.description: In his first Independence Day speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi today described himself as "an outsider to Delhi".

item.title: Independence Day: Five Tips to Financial Freedom
item.description: Have you ever given a serious thought to financial independence and what you are doing to achieve it?
